task.title: Configuring source addresses
task.shortdesc: The IP address (or range of IP addresses) to which a security policy applies is set on the Source Address tab of the Configuration window.

taskbody.prereq: You must have been allocated a static IP address before configuring the address.
taskbody.context: Use the Source Address tab to specify the source IP address for a security policy.

step.cmd: Select one of the following settings:

chrow.chdesc: Applies the rule to any IP address.

chdesc.p: Applies the rule to one IP address.
chdesc.note: Use the dotted decimal format. Example: 127.0.0.1

chrow.chdesc: Applies the rule to a block of IP addresses. The entry after the slash is the prefix length, and is a number from 1 to 32. Example: Network address selection dropdown field

Applies the rule to an address name created as a network object. If you use network objects in a policy, it is easier to define the policy if you pre-define those objects in ConfigurationObjects before you use them.
Applies the rule to a dynamic address name created as a network object.
